title: [Enhancement Request] UI interface improvement
body:
Feature description
---------
I would like to highlight few critical feature enhancements to improve the overall experience of doccano after using it for almost a month.

1. Members
- [ ]  Enable assigning a range of records to respective users directly from doccano UI by the project admin.
- [ ]  Expose which member annotated which record IDs to the other annotators - like displaying an icon when they have made the change in a record ID on the top right corner, just like we see in Microsoft presentation online when multiple users work on a single PPT.

2. Statistics
- [ ]  Display percentage of records checked/annotated by members against the total records assigned to them.
- [ ]  Any way to validate that the users have actually gone through the range of records assigned, like a check feature.

3. Labels
- [ ]  Displaying the record IDs against each label. For example, if I am performing Sequence Labelling, then for label PERSON, it should list down the record IDs having that label annotated.

4. Comments
- [ ]  Enable comments visible across all users that can eventually help clarify doubts when someone else encounters it
- [ ]  Capture and Display record ID against which the comment has been provided

5. Menu Visibility
- [ ]  Allow annotators to visualize the stats done by them as well as others
- [ ]  Allow annotators to visualize the label list

6. General
- [ ]  Push the `Delete All` button to the left instead of its current location. The admin might accidentally click on it when trying to click on `Projects` or Logout.
- [ ]  In dark mode, when we annotated a span, it becomes completely white and can't read the text inside the span. It becomes problematic when records are pre-annotated.

More to come as I encounter.
